intro: Sitobolium anthriscifolium, commonly known as the lesser cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and is often found in disturbed soils. It has a short lifecycle and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional herbal medicine.
